posts.name: Teddy
posts.cooked:
Here’s the cleaned-up version of your text:

While browsing the Questnav Thread, I noticed a mention of the Oak D camera with its Spectacular AI Tracking Suite as an alternative to Questnav. Curious about this, I purchased an Oak D Lite and began experimenting. After a few days and replacing the USB cable, I achieved excellent AI tracking results. However, occasional jumps and drifting occurred, along with struggles with rotation when objects were in front of the device. These issues likely stem from configuration settings or the fact that the Oak D Lite isn’t officially supported. At this point, I’m focusing on improving a visualizer for better performance. Let me know if anyone has suggestions or experiences to share.

link_counts.title: QuestNav: The Best Robot Pose Tracking System in FRC
Laser mice for localization and odemetry?

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: I’d like to see this with another model that has a dot projector. I plan on getting one in the near future. Combining that with a wider field of view (FOV) for the tracking cameras should enhance performance.

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: I’m hopeful that this might offer a solution that’s more compact, easier to set up, and requires fewer components compared to QuestNav. I also anticipate receiving an OAK-D Pro W soon.

posts.name: Teddy
posts.cooked: Slight update: Found a nice UI library that I should be able to set up fairly quickly so hopefully I will be able to post an initial prototype visualizer tomorrow.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: That one guy obsessed with programming

posts.name: Teddy
posts.cooked:
Progress has been made, and the testing UI is now semi-functional. Its functionality is still imperfect due to being developed quickly under time constraints, but it mostly works effectively.

The source code is available at [GitHub link].

The animated GIF indicates that rotation may disrupt positioning, though the exact cause remains unclear. Several potential explanations exist.

Further updates are expected soon.

Additionally, @viggy96 mentioned that the product isn't specifically tailored for a particular oak model, implying that your Oak D Pro should function correctly.

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: Do you know if the necessary Python packages for this can be installed on the roboRIO? Considered whether the 'host' computer being the roboRIO itself made sense.

posts.name: Teddy
posts.cooked: I put a list of Python dependencies on the GitHub readme. Unwise to try installing such a package on the Raspberry Pi. The April tag competition is already costly, and without benchmarking my tool, I don't think it's computationally efficient.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: That one guy obsessed with programming

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: Is it not offloaded to the OAK-D? Maybe it’s not offloaded on the Lite.

posts.name: rahilm
posts.cooked: I've been exploring the OAK-D for experimentation, but it appears they advise against running VSLAM processing on board with current-gen hardware: VIO and SLAM. The upcoming OAK 4, though exceeding FRC pricing, may offer sufficient computing power for such tasks.

posts.name: Teddy
posts.cooked:
As far as I know, AI does not offload to the oak. (The 'lite' will definitely not receive special treatment since it’s not even supported officially.)

As rahilm said, the producer of the oak themselves claim that the current oakds are not powerful enough.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: That one guy obsessed with programming

posts.name: Pedro Braga
posts.cooked: Dot projectors' legality—or viability—if this gains traction—is something I'm uncertain about. I’m unsure how resistant such systems are to external interference, though considering that 2-3 robots in a match have these in place, I’d hazard a guess that pose estimation could become unreliable for all involved.

link_counts.title: QuestNav: The Best Robot Pose Tracking System in FRC

posts.name: Teddy
posts.cooked:
More progress made!

I have fixed the rotation issue with my oak d Lite by setting the imu_to_camera matrix. Oseiskar helped me figure this out.

I've also been working on integrating apriltag support. However, my app crashes whenever it detects a tag and initializes the tracking system. I'm unsure why this happens.

Right now, the crash log suggests it might be related to libc, but since everything is proprietary, I can't confirm. Once apriltags work, I plan to refactor my project to focus on NT4 support and improve maintainability. After that, I won't need my own visualizer since advantagescope will handle it.

If anyone knows why the apriltags cause crashes, please share your thoughts!

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: That one guy obsessed with programming

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: QuestNav uses the same approach as the Meta Quest, which employs line projectors, but an intriguing observation is the potential impact of this technology's widespread adoption in FIRST Robotics Competition (FRC).

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: The AprilTag JSON file contains data captured by robots during navigation, typically including timestamps, positions (x and y coordinates), orientations, and possibly tag identifiers or detection confidence levels. The JSON structure uses key-value pairs, with keys such as "timestamp," "position_x," "position_y," and "orientation." These fields provide essential information about tag detection, aiding in understanding the robot's environment. Orientation may indicate headings in degrees or radians, and coordinates likely use a local grid system suitable for indoor navigation. Each deployment may add specific attributes like confidence metrics or tag details. Proper handling of asynchronous data, error management, efficient processing methods, security measures, and continuous monitoring are crucial for effective integration and optimization of the navigation system.

posts.name: Teddy
posts.cooked: I made a tool to convert Limelight FMap files to Spectacular AI Tags.json files. It doesn't matter whether you use it or not; the issue isn't with loading the tags—it crashes whenever it encounters a tag and attempts to initiate its tracking system.
